diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Type 1 Hyperlipoproteinemia due to Compound Heterozygous Rare Variants in GCKR
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Sanger sequencing of known T1HLP genes did not reveal disease-causing mutations. Whole exome sequencing identified compound heterozygous rare variants (p.Val103Met and p.Arg540Gln) in the GCKR gene, suggesting that these variants cause extreme hypertriglyceridemia likely by inducing excessive hepatic lipogenesis.
